intro: Allochrusa versicolor, commonly known as the variable alga, is a species of green alga that thrives in freshwater environments. It is characterized by its ability to produce a variety of pigments, which contribute to its variable coloration. The plant typically grows in shallow, nutrient-rich waters and is often found in association with other aquatic vegetation. Its structure consists of filaments that form dense mats on the water surface or submerged substrates. Allochrusa versicolor plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various aquatic organisms.
